snippet.title: Captain Blood (Atari ST) Longplay with Full Walkthrough
snippet.description:
↓↓↓ PLEASE READ ↓↓↓

Here's the complete walkthrough of (L'Arche du) Captain Blood. The game can be completed in about 1h30 with the instructions provided below. The goal is to track down and disintegrate the last 5 clones before Captain Blood's health totally degenerates.

Some tips: 
- Preferably start the game with a planet occupied by an Izwal (Small Yoko) or a Migrax (Great Bounty). Restart the game if you run into another alien.
- If you start with the Migrax Great Bounty, go directly to 08:08. The Sinox Good Spirit will give you the coordinates of Yoko later 01:01:14
- Note the coordinates of each planet because they change with each new game! Also note their name, the name of the aliens and their race.
- Hold the right mouse button to skip the jumps to hyperspace. The same goes for planet destruction. This will save you time.
- Hold down the Escape key to skip the planet flyby. You'll also save a lot of time!
- Use the arrow keys on the galaxy map for greater accuracy..
- As you can see in my video, sometimes you have to insist when you talk to an alien. Some of them are a bit absent-minded :)

Walkthrough:
00:00 Title Screen / Music
01:58 Start / Language Selection
03:49 Izwal Small Yoko (Bow-Bow)
- "blood"
- "coord planet croolis-ulv"
- "coord planet migrax"
08:08 Migrax Great Bounty (Reproduction 14)
- "teleport"
09:51 Teleport Great Bounty to a random planet
- "yes" (until he talks about the planet Spirit)
- "coord planet spirit"
- "coord planet missile brave"
13:59 Teleport Great Bounty to Reproduction 14
15:49 Migrax Good Spirit (Reproduction 128)
- "say code"
- "duplicate"
19:55 Teleport and disintegrate Duplicate 2
22:00 Croolis-ulv Dead Genetic (Trap 4)
- "croolis-var"
24:22 Croolis-var Good Nonsense (Trap 2)
- "croolis-ulv"
26:33 Croolis-ulv Howdy Prison (Bad Trap)
28:00 Croolis-ulv Insult 4 (Insult 80)
29:33 Croolis-ulv Howdy Prison (Bad Trap)
- "yes"
31:35 Croolis-ulv Great Destroy (Great Trap)
- "croolis-var"
- "trap 4"
- "bad trap"
- "insult 80"
35:42 Izwal Small Friend (Idea 762)
- "moi ami"
- "coord planet good friend"
- "coord planet small home"
38:50 Tricephal Good Friend (Small Home)
- "coord planet sinox"
40:51 Sinox Good Spirit (128)
- "impossible not sinox"
- "duplicate"
43:48 Antenna 1 (Kristo 15)
- "coord planet robhead"
Teleport antenna to a random planet
47:48 Antenna 2 (Kristo 7)
- "coord planet robhead"
Teleport antenna to a random planet
50:25 Antenna 3 (Kristo 34)
- "coord planet robhead"
Teleport antenna to a random planet
53:02 Antenna 4 (Kristo 8)
- "coord planet robhead"
Teleport antenna to a random planet
55:35 Robhead 1
- "planet" to get the planet name
57:03 Robhead 2
- "planet" to get the planet name
58:25 Robhead 3
- "planet" to get the planet name
59:44 Robhead 4
- "planet" to get the planet name
01:01:14 Sinox Good Spirit (128)
gives Yoko's coord if you started the game with Migrax Great Bounty
01:03:21 Sinox Brain Radioactivity (256)
- name of planet Robhead 1
- name of planet Robhead 2
- name of planet Robhead 3
- name of planet Robhead 4 
01:05:50 Robhead 4
01:06:50 Destroy planet Reproduction 14
01:07:58 Destroy planet Reproduction 128
01:09:27 Robhead 4
01:11:01 Teleport and disintegrate Duplicate 3
01:12:46 Spirit Ondoyante Torka (Spirit)
01:14:30 Tubular-Brain Brain 4
- Wait for Hour 125 (speed up emulator)
01:18:06 Tubular-Brain Brain 4 - Hour 125
- "code friend friend"
- "coord planet kingpak"
01:20:20 Race with Kingpak
- follow him from planet to planet and when possible, teleport him to a random planet
01:29:39 Duplicate 4
- Wait for Hour 160 (speed up emulator)
01:32:26 Izwal Small Yoko (Bow-Bow) - Hour 160
- "duplicate"
01:34:07 Duplicate 1
- "yes"
- Teleport and disintegrate Duplicate 1
01:36:34 Duplicate 4
- Teleport and disintegrate Duplicate 4
01:38:54 Duplicate 5
- Teleport and disintegrate Duplicate 5
01:40:54 End
- Teleport Torka and... live happily!

I hope you enjoyed the trip! Captain Blood remains one of my best childhood memories ❤ 

Scenario: Philippe Ulrich
Software and Graphics: Didier Bouchon
Music: Jean-Michel Jarre (from track "Ethnicolor", Zoolook album)
Additional graphics: Michel Rho

(L'Arche du) Captain Blood is an adventure game developed by ERE Informatique / Exxos and published by Metal Hurlant / Infogrames / Mindscape in February 1988 on Atari ST, Amiga, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, MS-DOS, Thomson TO8 / T09, Macintosh, ZX Spectrum and Apple IIgs.

#retrogaming #atarist #longplay #walkthrough
